intro: Lysimachia dabieshanensis, commonly known as the Dabie Mountains yellow flower, is a flowering plant native to China, specifically the Dabie Mountains region. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or rocky crevices. It features opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth texture and is often found in mountainous areas with high humidity. Due to its limited distribution and unique ecological role, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
